results.title: Female perversions
results.creator_credit: Mindy Affrime, Mindy Affrime Productions and Susan Streitfeld
results.brief_description: This fascinating, fragmented and complex drama eschews traditional narrative structure to present an intellectually challenging, feminist adaptation of Louise Kaplan’s book “Female Perversions: the Temptations of Emma Bovary.” The film centres on Eve, a talented lawyer who has just won a case against a disreputable business magnate. However, anticipating a meeting with the governor regarding her aspirations to become a judge brings to the surface insecurities and anxieties. She compensates for her lack of self-esteem by relying more and more on her captivating looks, and by buying expensive lingerie and make-up. Just as Eve is facing the highest point in her life, Madelyn, her unstable sister, is experiencing her lowest when she is arrested for shoplifting. When an incident from their childhood resurfaces, both sisters must confront their painful issues and find some sense of control in their lives. Cast includes: Tilda Swinton, Amy Madigan, Karen Sillas, Laila Robins and Clancy Brown.

results.title: Female cycle
results.brief_description: A simple animated explanation of menstruation. It shows how ovaries produce eggs, one of which moves to the surface each month and enters the fallopian tube to travel to the uterus. Secretions from these organs enter the blood and prepare the uterus for the fertilised egg and cause a period.

results.title: Fellow Traveller
results.creator_credit: Michael Wearing, BBC Film Unit, Home Box Office, BFI and Philip Saville
results.brief_description: A leading American screenwriter arrives in London in the mid-50’s to make a new life. Back in Hollywood, a famous movie star shoots himself. The link between these involves a girl and a history - that of the McCarthy witch hunts and the careers they destroyed. Asa Kaufman (Ron Silver) finds work writing a Robin Hood serial in the eccentric world of Britain’s new ITV, but he can’t escape the psychic and political pressures that drove him into exile. With Daniel J. Travanti.

results.title: Fellini: the director as creator
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Fulco Film
results.brief_description: This short film on the late, great, Italian film director was the first time motion picture cameras were permitted on the set to reveal his creative process. Harold Mantell’s documentary uses footage shot behind the scenes and on the sets of of Fellini’s film “Juliet of the Spirits” (1965) (304304) as a canvas to talk about this acclaimed director. The film shows the magnificent film sets, Fellini’s character people (whose faces were invented for his films), the relationship with his actor/wife Guilietta Masina, and the cast and crew. The film also features his techniques of improvisation and interview material. “Juliet of the Spirits” is held in the Collection on VHS. While the film is crammed with interesting facts about Fellini, the man and creative artist, it is not intended as a guide to his body of work. Another documentary in the Collection on VHS, “Ciao Frederico: A Portrait Of Frederico Fellini,” was also made during the shooting of “Satyricon”.

results.title: Fellini Satyricon
results.creator_credit: Alberto Grimaldi, United Artists Corporation and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: More than any other director, Fredrico Fellini has created a coherent universe compounded of his personal vision and anxiety, where each work is held together by filaments of memory and imagery. All his films are picaresque and fragmentary, representing a subliminal search by the protagonist(s) for a life more fulfilling than the one lived now. The Rome of his Satyricon is borne out of his imagination. In it the costumes, lighting, architecture, gestures, eating habits, all forms of behaviour, conspire to startle and disorient the viewer. For years Fellini had contemplated a film version of Petronius’ book, a fragmentary account of a group of Roman students on a seemingly meandering journey, its unfinished quality appealing to his open-ended, fractured style of filmmaking. Cast includes Martin Potter, Max Born, Hiram Keller, Capucine, Lucia Bose, Gorden Mitchell and Alain Cuny. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Fellini's Casanova
results.creator_credit: Alberto Grimaldi, TCF, Produzioni Europee Associati and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: Freely adapted from “The story of my Life” by Giacomo Casanova, Fellini directs, in his own highly original style, the most detailed account of Casanova’s life yet put on the screen. The magnificent camerawork of Guiseppe Rotunno and art design of Danilo Donato combine with the music of Nino Rota and the acting talent of Donald Sutherland to produce one of the most unusual films of the 70’s, a sprawling, erotic and often moving masterpiece. Anthony Burgess acted as dialogue consultant for this English version.

results.title: Fell
results.brief_description: This experimental puppet animation has an uneasy feel reminiscent of videos made in the 90’s by Tool guitarist Adam Jones. A small wooden figure tries to stand unassisted on trembling limbs as nameless shadows flicker just out of sight. “Fell” was an outstanding contribution to the 2000 Diegesis Program. It is a surreal and beautiful work.

results.title: Felix the cat: the movie
results.creator_credit: Felix the Cat Creations, Animation Film Cologne, Don Oriolo, Christian Schneider, James Schenk and Tibor Hernadi
results.brief_description: The lovable Felix the Cat is back in a full-length movie to entertain and delight a new generation of young children as well as those who grew up with this famous cartoon cat. Join Felix in an adventure full of twists and turns as he is summoned to the golden Kingdom of Oriana, where the evil Duke Zill has just escaped exile and is plotting to turn the peaceful green land of Oriana into a profitable land, but one that will be an industrial nightmare. With his magical Bag of Tricks and the help of the beautiful Princess Oriana, Felix sets out to save the Kingdom from Zill and his mechanical troops. Based on an original story by Don Oriolo. Original Felix characters designed by Joe Oriolo.

results.title: Felix the Cat
results.brief_description: A bag of high flying adventure with Felix the Cat. See Felix pull all elevators and airplanes out of his magic bag of tricks and fly to the moon with Pointdexter. Watch Felix capture Rock Bottom and delight in the antics of the professor. It’s all here in an hour of fun! Rated: G

results.title: Felidae
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt, Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Vanessa White
results.brief_description: This hand-drawn animation tells the story of two people’s sightings of a big-cat or panther in the Dandenongs of Melbourne. The visuals accompanying the voice-overs serve to add to the story in more abstract terms with painted film and iconic images of panthers intermixed with the voices.
